snippet: After a 33-year reign, Queen Beatrix handed the title of monarch to her son, Willem-Alexander, the country’s first king in 123 years.
abstract: Willem-Alexander of the House of Orange-Nassau becomes Netherlands' first king in 123 years when his mother, Queen Beatrix, steps down from throne; Beatrix is third successive queen to abdicate, changing her title to princess.

byline.original: By ANDREW HIGGINS and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Andrew Higgins reported from Amsterdam, and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: After a 33-year reign, Queen Beatrix handed the title of monarch to her son, Willem-Alexander, the country’s first king in 123 years.

headline.seo: Willem-Alexander Is New King of Netherlands
headline.main: A King Takes the Throne, and a Nation Celebrates
headline.print_headline: A King Takes the Throne, and a Nation Celebrates
